intro: Malcolmia tenuissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf mallows, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Malcolmia tenuissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
